title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's win over Denmark in his Olympic debut.
Despite giving up two regrettable goals, Swayman joked about colorful boards affecting his vision, citing his colorblindness.
Team USA defeated Denmark with strong offense, overshadowing Swayman's performance, who made only 18 stops in the win.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum's potential return from an Achilles injury is anticipated to impact the Celtics' playoff run.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony express confidence in Tatum's All-Star level play upon his return.
Tatum is practicing with the Celtics' G League affiliate, indicating progress in his injury recovery.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space for offseason additions, targeting Colts wide receiver Alec Pierce.
Packers offensive tackle Rasheed Walker and Bills center Connor McGovern are potential targets for Patriots' offensive line needs.
Ravens tight end Isaiah Likely and Eagles edge rusher Jaelan Phillips are other key free agents for Patriots to consider.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN is now MLB's streaming partner, offering MLB.TV as an add-on for ESPN Unlimited subscribers at $134.99 per season.
Non-ESPN Unlimited subscribers can access MLB.TV for $149.99, including a free month trial of ESPN Unlimited.
Current MLB.TV subscribers are auto-renewed; new subscribers must register via the ESPN app, linking to ESPN's services.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Maine Celtics, sparking speculation about his return from an Achilles injury.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. reported Tatum appeared in good form during the G League practice, fueling team excitement.
Despite practice participation, the Celtics maintain Tatum's return timetable remains uncertain, with no official change in his injury status.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the 2026 WalletHub study, scoring highest in higher education attainment.
More than 47% of adults in Massachusetts have a bachelor's degree, and nearly 22% hold graduate degrees.
Vermont and Maryland placed second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked lowest in education.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare Honus Wagner T206 baseball card, owned by a Taunton family, is up for auction with bids closing Feb. 21.
The card, ungraded and kept for 116 years, is estimated to fetch over $4.7 million, including a buyer's premium.
Auctioneer Ken Goldin, featured in Netflix's "King of Collectibles," discovered the card's existence during filming with the Shields family.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start in net for Team USA against Denmark in his first Olympic game.
Swayman, 27, helped Team USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship, recording a shutout in the final.
Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy will also play for Team USA, joining Swayman in Saturday's lineup.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: New England Aquarium identified a dead North Atlantic right whale off Virginia as a 3-year-old female.
Her death marks the 43rd in the ongoing North Atlantic Right Whale Unusual Mortality Event since 2017.
The whale, discovered on February 10, is the 2023 calf of right whale #3293 Porcia, who has lost three offspring.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts Department of Public Health reports seven pediatric flu deaths this season, adding up to 260 total flu-related deaths.
Officials urge vaccinations amid flu strain on hospitals, with seven adults and one child reported dead in the latest weekly data.
Flu activity surged in January, beginning to decline in February, yet still circulating, prompting continued public health warnings.
